“Shall we begin Damon?” “Sure let’s get this over with, so that she can come back in and we can talk.”

A few minutes later they are soon done and clean up and then recover their bearings just as she walked in “Oh you guys are done already? I figured it would be possibly longer.” “We do not take forever though. Mostly water types will drag it out.” “Anyways, how are you Allis?” Damon asks. “Meh my day could be better. My team is small me, and my Eevee.” “Ooh, an Eevee they are incredibly cute.” “I Agree that they are cute, I would never evolve it against its will and only when it wants to.” “Do you agree on that for all Pokémon?”

Equally yes I do prefer to let them decide if they want to evolve, some people would force them to evolve even if they didn’t want to…” “Yeah we know what you mean we have seen a couple forced with stones. Luckily legendries don’t evolve, or at least most of them some have different forms.” “Landorus, Tornadus, and Thunderus. If I am correct.” “They do have beast forms.” “I am glad that we agree on some things, there will probably be some things in the future that we might disagree on or argue, but hopefully it won’t destroy all of our relationships together.”

“What do you mean *Our Relationships*?” “Well we are under you control technically if you caught us. So we are to be used as you see fit.” “Well it is true I have 2 powerful legends in my team, but I wouldn’t want to abuse your powers. Speaking of Powers let me scan you in my pokédex so I can see what moves you know.” “Yes Mam.” And as thus Lyrica and Damon line up so she can scan them. Damon knows, Dragon Pulse, Protect, Luster Purge, and Memento. While Lyrica knew, Mist Ball, Heal Pulse, Psycho Shift, and Psychic.

“You both have a good set of moves; your moves more likely are made for tag battles as some are used on others.” “Well we were meant to be with the other. In all actuality I was human at one point.” “What no way.” “Yes way Lyrica here fell in love with me as a human and wanted me as a Mate so she changed me into a Latios while depleting most of her power.” “Wow, I would have never guessed it.” “Most people wouldn’t think that it is possible to turn a human into a Pokémon, But any legendary or even Arceus itself can transform a human, but only if they are pure of heart.”

“I looked at Damon and saw a *Pure Heart* and a very understanding person and that he would make an excellent mate and companion.” “I never realized it was possible; Wait where are your Pokémon then?” “I released them; some of them were very reluctant to leave. But after a little convincing they accepted.”

“Could I be transformed then?” “Well yeah, then we wouldn’t be here at this moment, so I think it isn’t necessary. We wouldn’t want your Eevee to be very puzzled about its surroundings like my Altaria would be.” “I guess so, I got an idea… Wait can any of you call Arceus?” “I can’t as I am turned into and not an actual Pokémon.” Lyrica looks very fidgety she then pulls out from her wing a white flute. “What? Lord Arceus gave every Legendary on to call it whenever needed.” She then puts it to her lips and plays an eerie song and there is a flash of lightning as Arceus appears.

“Yes Latias you called me? What do you need?” “Ummm… I transformed a human into my mate as he had a pure heart, and the girl behind you wanted to talk to you.” “Hmmm… this human does indeed contain a Pure Heart. As for you what would you like I can see you also have a pure heart.” “I don’t want to stay a Pokémon I would like to ask if I can have the ability to become a Pokémon?” “Hmmm… I have never heard of this kind of request, but I can understand you wish to stay a trainer but become a Pokémon when you want. I will grant it I will also allow you to change into a legendary if you wish.”

“Thank you Lord Arceus.” “Here have this incase anything comes up.” As he hands a flute to both Damon and Allis. “Thank you Lord Arceus.” Arceus touches a stone to Allis’s head and she glows a bright white color before fading and with thus exits through his portal.

In the region of Sinnoh, there was a place called Mt. Coronet. High above it was the sanctuary of the Legendary Pokémon of the world, the Hall of Origin. Nobody has ever seen nor visited it before so knowledge about its splendor remains unknown. Residing inside it was the creator of the whole universe, the Alpha Pokémon, Arceus.

But she feels a bit unsatisfied about her life and so she looks for her special one.

This is her story of how she came and united with the savior of the world, Ash Ketchum.

Arceus looked down from her ancient and jeweled throne. She constantly watched over the Earth, searching for any impending peril. Although she noticed some problems, it was nothing that people couldn't handle themselves. She sighed loudly to herself, slightly frustrated that nothing major happened. It had been like this for over a week now and she had been lonely, all the other legendaries were down on the Earth living out their lives the usually way whilst she was stuck here, acting as a guardian over her creations.

Suddenly, as she was scanning, a familiar little speck caught her eyes. It was a boy, around sixteen years old. She looked at him, weirdly enthralled, with more detail and noticed that it was Ash Ketchum, the Chosen One. She remembered how he was able to save her and that memory made her blush deeply.

"Ash…" She sighed, thinking that she and he would never be able to be together. At that time, it was considered taboo to love a Pokémon, what more mating. But then, she was a Goddess, she could alter humans' law about it.

She started to get ideas of how she could make her day better. Suddenly, the idea entered her head to pay a visit to the Chosen One. Plus what harm could it do to leave her post anyways? It isn't like there were any immediate dangers around.

From a desk in the far side of the room, Arceus telepathically gathered a piece of paper and a pen.

On the note, she wrote:

Dear Legends and My Creations,

I will be going on a little trip to pay a visit to the Chosen One. If anything comes up, I trust that all of you can handle it. I'll be back soon.

P.S. Please don't fight each other. If any of you does, there's a great Judgment waiting for you.

Arceus

She posted the piece of paper on the door and, with a blinding flash of light, teleported out of the heavens with a smile.

Lost, alone, and severely cold, you lay beneath a mound of snow atop the mountain. It had all come down to this.. This was your fate to die all along...

Suddenly- FWOOSH! A bright light swooped over your freezing soon-to-be corpse. In the midst of the ferocious blizzard, you heard what almost sounded like cackling flames. You shivered as you began turning your head, hopeful that a rescuer had found you on the brink of death, or maybe one of your beloved friends came to you, sensing danger. It was blurry from the icicles hanging from your eyelashes, but you could make out what almost seemed to be a giant bird. Oh great, some vulture, hungry for your frosty bones. Wait... Why would a vulture be in the snow? You must be hallucinating, then... Right?

Wrong. It had moved closer,and pushed away the snow that was covering you. You looked closer, your view starting to darken. Was it Articuno? Possibly the cause of the blizzard, here to finish the job? Wrong again, it was the fiery Moltres! Here to save you with its blazing feathers of pure warmth! Although, even with your rapidly blurring vision, you could see Moltres's feathers were dimmed by the cold just as you had... Maybe you both had no hope left. Before you could think another word, everything went dark. Had you finally died...?

You reawaken, only to find yourself in a still-dark place. It was much warmer though, and it felt as though your icy clothes had been removed. Feeling around with your five senses slowly regaining, you felt that it was moist... And squishy... Where had you just awoken?!

It had always been your dream, and maybe even in your heart it felt like destiny, that you would one day get to see the graceful bird goddess of ice.

You one day ventured off to another snowy land, still in search after many harsh years. Once, you could faintly hear an echo of her wondrous cry many months ago. You went on wishing for the best as you hiked across the barren, yet magnificent snow. It was a perfect kingdom, worthy of Articuno's rule.

After hours of trekking, the cold of which you had previously grown used to turned on you. It blasted a massive gust of tiny icicles. You slid, trying to keep your grip on the surface of the snow with no luck. You fell over, collapsing into a towering bank of the puffy, white cold. A blizzard you were in no way prepared for began rising up. You at first seen it as a set-back, but this thought soon vanished as you heard a familiar shriek.

"Articuno!" You tried shouting, your voice being muffled by the raging winds.
She cried back in response, your happiness fading as you seen a huge, magnificent figure fall from the sky crashing into the blurry abyss beyond you. You gasped, cold, salty tears forming in your heart-broken eyes. You winced and trudged forward, determined to do everything in your power to save this mighty goddess from her seemingly-inevitable death. You charged ahead, the essence of your bravery pumping through your veins with immense force and hope. You wouldn't let anything happen to your beloved Articuno...

Crystal daggers swarmed onto your face from the blizzard, another sign of her horrid pain only worsening. This wouldn't be her sorrowful fate, not if you had anything to do about it! You gathered up every last ounce of your strength, tears flying off your blushing, red cheeks behind you. With all your might, you managed to reach moments away from her savoir. You looked below you, halting and panting, seeing the immense ditch created form her long fall. You slid down the sides and trotted up to her, one of your tears staining her sparkling feathers... This was the heart of the struggle, jagged fangs of ice jutted out around the ditch you were both in. You couldn't help but cry... She was dying... She was-

Bleeding... Her glowing, crimson poured out from several places, all places that would result in immediate death for those with slightly lesser strength... Was there any hope left at all...? Had you made it all the way here just to-

Suddenly! She began rising into the air! A shimmering sapphire aura shot out from her almost lifeless eyes, and the blizzard started swarming around her, covering her view from you. It was a miracle, truly! There was absolute grace and wonder of this impossible event; she was being reborn! New life coursed through her and you, sharing the same breath-taking feeling within yourselves. It was glorious, you felt as one with her heart, feeling the same pounding quakes of love and innocence from deep inside you. You had found yourselves, and everything felt as if it were melting away. The hurricane around Artinuo vanished and she stood mighty in the air, all wounds gone and an elegant swirl of sparkling flakes hovering around her beautiful feathers. She slowly dove down, floating before you and embracing you with her grand, outstretched wings. You smiled and cried, happy to be united with her...

12523222.content:
As Suicune approaches, you go quiet, not wanting to spook her off. You'd heard stories of the three legendary dogs of Johto, and each were known to be very rarely sighted, and very flighty when spotted. The fact that you've managed to get this close to one without even trying has to mean something special.

Suicune's eyes are wide and curious, and they sweep over you, taking in every detail of your form. You remain frozen, fearing even one sudden movement will scare her off, and you inspect her in turn. Her eyes are a bright amber, and clear as crystal. The huge horn upon her head gleams in the light like a polished blue gemstone. Her fur and mane, silky smooth, ruffle softly along with her twin tails in a wind that you cannot feel.

Her roving eyes drift back to yours, and you stare at each other in silence. You're suddenly aware of every small noise around you; your breathing, your heartbeat, the soft rustling of the leaves of the plants around you... You feel calmer than you've felt in days.

The serenity is broken when her calm eyes narrow into angry slits. Faster than you can comprehend, she whips around lunges straight for your neck. You gasp in shock, with no time to do anything but cringe and flinch away as Suicune rushes forward to rip out your throat with her teeth—

But instead of shredding fangs, you feel something warm and wet press against your neck and slide up your chin. You open your eyes to see Suicune dragging her tongue up your left cheek, leaving a trail of saliva that quickly grows cold in the cool forest air.

She pulls back, and trills—a sound unlike any you've heard before, with a pleasant sort of tune to it. Evidently, she's pleased with herself for scaring you like that.

A beautiful voice fills your ears. "I'm sorry! You just looked so delicious!"

You blink, confused. The Pokemon's lips hadn't moved. "You... Just spoke?" You stutter out.

Suicune trills again, and this time it sounds almost like a giggle. "It is telepathy, an ability many legendary pokemon have! I can speak to you with my thoughts." The Pokemon pauses and backs up, giving herself enough space to bow. She does so, bending her forelegs elegantly. "There's no need to be afraid of me; I am Suicune, and you are welcome in my forest."

"I can stay here?" You ask. Relief floods through you. This foreboding forest might just become a sanctuary, after all the time you've spent running from your only home...

"Of course! You're not a hunter," She says, walking toward you again, "Not a poacher, not a troublemaker." She brushes up against you with her silky soft fur, walking around your back, "You don't mean harm, so you're welcome to stay." She finishes looping around you, looking back into your eyes. "I just have one question to ask..."

Embarrassed, you extend your arms, getting an armload of fur as you embrace the giantess again.
"Now, not so bad, is it?" she asks, smiling.

You blush again.
"Now then, sleep tight my little guy," the giantess leans forward, her eyes closed.

For a split second, you wonder what she's up to.

But you soon find out as the pink lips of the pokemon pucker up and press themselves against your left cheek, which burns with embarrassment as the gigantic pair makes contact with your face.
"Sweet dreams!" Mesprit chimes, before laying her head back down, her tails wrapping around her belly below.

You don't reply, still quite shocked about the kiss she gave you. You shake your head, trying to rid yourself of the embarrassment, before laying your head down on the furry surface of Mesprit's chest.

Soon enough, the mix of drowsiness and comfort claims your consciousness. Darkness falls in your mind, and you follow it without opposing.

Mesprit notices you asleep, and giggles silently.
"Who would have expected this? I found myself a cutie~" she chimes, before yawning.

Soon, the giantess joins you to the dream realm...

--

"Wake up sleepy! Time to rise and shine!" a cheery voice calls, disturbing your slumber.

You pay it no mind, and keep on sleeping.
"Come on! You don't want to miss a day of fun, do you?!" the voice chimes.
"Maybe I do..." you mumble, trying to cling to your sleep.

"Nonsense! Me and you are going to do lots of stuff today, and I won't take ‘no’ for an answer!"
"Well, that's all you're getting for now..." you mumble again, snuggling deeper into your bed.

You hear a silent giggle, then you feel yourself moving.

Instantaneously, your consciousness returns as you experience, for a second, an immense pressure while your whole being is soaked to the bone in water. A bunch of bubbles comes out of your mouth as you scream.

You're quickly pulled back, and your eyes shut open. Only to see a giant, pink headed fiend snickering down at you. You notice that Mesprit is standing - or rather floating - by the entrance of her cave.

You realize that she just placed you outside, right under the lake.
"Why?!" you ask, enraged. The giantess shrugs.
"Had to wake you up somehow!" she chimes, resuming her giggling.
"By the way, good morning! Did you sleep well?" she then asks.

You roll your eyes.

--

"Please, don't do that again." you say as you gulp down the last bite of a berry you have been eating. After her morning prank, Mesprit brought you to the surface, and she provided you a single berry for breakfast. To her, it was just a cheri berry. To you, it was like eating a boulder.

Mesprit gulps down the remains of her own meal, before turning down to you, who are sitting beside her.
"No promises!" she laughs. You sigh.

Before a giant paw snatches you up.
"Aw, come on, it wasn't so bad, was it?" Mesprit asks, pushing you against her face as she nuzzles you.
"Yes. Yes it was." you reply, annoyed. Mesprit smiles sympathetically.

"Come on, how about I make it up to you? How about I let you pick what we do next?" she asks.
"You can choose. But... thanks anyway..." you say, trying to not sound ungrateful.

The giantess smiles as a few ideas take place in her mind.
"Well...
12533222221121112221.title: Cuddles and bad jokes

choices: Mesprit intends to take things further...
Another pokemon shows up, interrupting her...
125332222211211122211.content:
"Say, would you like to play with me?" Mesprit asks you.
"... Play?" you repeat.
"What kind of playing?"

"I'm older than you might think, small one. Not the kind kids would understand," she says with a wink. Your cheeks go red.
"Oh..." you mutter.
"... You're not talking about..."

Mesprit giggles.
"Hey, we only met yesterday," she remarks, playfully wagging a finger.
"No, today we're playing with something more... calm," she says. Your cheeks slowly return to their regular color.
"What do you have in mind then?" you ask.

Mesprit giggles again.
"Ever heard of worshipping?" she asks. The term isn't unfamiliar to you.
"... Uh..." you reply, vaguely blushing at the perspective.
"Yup. Today we're playing with that," Mesprit chimes as she suddenly starts to float upwards, soon reaching the branches of a high tree.

She lays belly down on a branch, gently placing you in front of her before letting her limbs hang from the branch.

Before you can question about what you should do, Mesprit picks you with psychic and moves you onto her fur-covered back.

"Been a while since I got some attention there," she says, before looking back at you.
"Now, you give my back a good pampering. And, if you're good enough, I'll be the one pampering you~" she says cheerily, clearly enjoying the situation.

Not seeing anything bad with this game, you nod your head and look down at the soft ground beneath your feet, trying to figure out how should you start.

Unsure, you look back at Mesprit, only to find that she has relaxed, her head resting on the branch like her limbs, suggesting that she's leaving everything in your hands.

Sighing, you kneel down and decide to start by giving Mesprit's back a massage.

Your arms extend, your hands press into the fur as you start rubbing the smooth, warm skin beneath the fur. Which shakes as the giantess feels your touch.

You start walking on the wide surface of the giantess' back as you rub each inch of it, pleased moans starting to escape Mesprit's mouth.
"That's it... keep it up..." you hear her mumble.

Your fingers retract, your rubbing changes into scratching. Then again into petting, your hands emerging from the fur and starting to stroke it.

"Oh..." Mesprit moans. The human is doing a wonderful job.
"Yep... you truly deserve a good pampering after you're done..." she says.

You smile, finding yourself slightly motivated.

Rub-scratch-pet, rub-scratch-pet, rub-scratch-pet, rub-scratch-pet, rub-scratch-pet...

"Mhh... enough..." Mesprit says. One of her tails moves from behind you as it coils around your waist and lifts your body from her back. Mesprit sits up, the tail holding you moving as she drops you into her awaiting hands below.

"You're good at this!" she compliments with a smile. You wave a hand dismissively.
"Now, if I'm not mistaken, I told that I would have returned the favor if you were good," she continues.

"And...?"

"Well, you were wonderful. Meaning-" you are suddenly manipulated so that you're laying belly down on the soft palm of the giantess.
"Your turn~" she chirps.

Soon, you feel her other, free paw reaching on your own back. Mesprit starts petting your small body gently, her paw softly sliding on your back.

You catch yourself sighing as the large paw keeps moving along the length of your whole back.
"You like this?" Mesprit asks from behind you.
"Mhh..." you reply, making the giantess giggle merrily.

"Some cute one you are~" she chimes. You blush.

--

A while passes like this, in silence, with Mesprit keeping up her petting.

"Well, I think that's enough," she suddenly breaks the silence as she removes her paw from you.
"Aw..." you complain, making the giantess giggle.

Mesprit drops you onto her belly and leans back against the tree, her arms relaxing as she gazes down at you.
"Someone enjoyed himself I see~" she snickers.

"I'd be lying if I told the opposite," you admit with a pleased sigh.
"Hehehe, did I make it up to you then?" she asks.

You remember about her earlier prank.
"Totally." you reply.
"Aw, thanks!" she says.

Suddenly, you feel a pair of lips briefly pecking your head, making you blush.
"Uh...".

"Hey, the day's still long, and we still have lots of things to do~" Mesprit suddenly chimes. You look back at her.
"Like what?" you ask.
125332222211211122211.title: Worship game

choices: "Let's resume our game!" Mesprit chimes. Cat and mouse it is...
Actually, Uxie has a different idea...
1253322222112111222112.content:
"Well, we can play with something more simple now. What do you think?" Mesprit asks as she starts to float off the tree branch and flying above the lake.

"Like what, Mesprit?" you ask.

The giantess seems to ponder an answer, before she grins down at you.
"Cat and mouse." she says with a snicker.

The game is not unfamiliar to you.
"The... the one where one of us hides until the other finds them or the time runs out?" you ask. Mesprit nods.
"And just guess our roles~"

You don't even have to think about it.
"I'm the mouse." you say with a sigh. Mesprit energetically nods her head while descending to the ground, letting you down on the grass, which is more like a forest to you.
"If you can hide from me for a while," she says.
"You win. That means you'll get a special reward."

Your head is quickly filled up with questions about what the reward could be. However, they're soon reduced to nothing as Mesprit talks again.
"However, if I catch you, I win. That means..." she snickers, licking her lips.
"Kitty gets her mouse." she snickers again.
"In any way she wishes.'

You pale a bit, but nod your head, quickly recalling that, if you lose, you won't be in any real danger... you hope. And, after all, you won't necessarily lose...

... Right?


Before you can formulate an answer, Mesprit turns around.
"Now you go hide, while I'll count to... one hundred," she says.
"One... two..." she then starts to count.

Immediately, you turn around and sprint away. You don't want to lose and, in order to win, you have to find a good hiding spot.

You briefly glance backwards, checking if Mesprit is still looking away.

Even though you spent less than fifteen hours with her, you quickly learned how mischievous she is. She could be easily cheating right now...

Luckily Mesprit is still looking away. You gaze back in front of yourself... only to notice at the last second that two, identical things are in front of you.

You end up bumping into them, falling down on your behind. Feeling a bit dazed, you look up.

The color drains from your face as you notice a gigantic blue creature towering above you. It looks much like Mesprit.

The only difference is its head, which is yellow instead of pink, and it's round. Its eyes are closed, you notice.

Even so, the creature definitely felt you as its head moves down, making you feel like those closed eyes are gazing down at you.


"... Hi there," the creature says in a feminine voice as she bends to pick you up. You quickly get back on your feet as two huge paws get a hold of you and scoop you up.

You weakly squirm to get free, but at this reduced size, such task is impossible to achieve. However, the pokemon soon releases you, letting you sit onto her open palm.

"What are you? You seem like a human, but... only much smaller..." the newcomer bluntly says.
"How did you get this small, human?"

Hearing a new voice, Mesprit stops counting and turns around, noticing a familiar pokemon holding her little human.

"Hi Uxie!" she chimes cheerfully while floating closer.
"I see you've found my mouse~" she then playfully says.

"... Mesprit, what happened to this human? How did he get so small?" the newcomer asks.

At this point, Mesprit smiles.
"I did it!" she chimes, hovering closer to the yellow headed creature.

The pokemon points her closed eyelids on Mesprit. You assume that she's curious.
"This human came here. According to what he said, he was desperate. So I granted him a wish," Mesprit explains with a hint of a blush.

"Such wish required me to shrink him down... and then, we found that we like each other's company. So now, he lives with me!" she exclaims with a bright smile.

The pokemon holding you opens her mouth, confused.
"What?" she asks. Mesprit nods.
The new pokemon looks back down at you.
"... Did you agree to this?" she asks.

Feeling slightly uncomfortable, you slowly nod.

Mesprit giggles as she senses your discomfort. She decides to fix that.
"Small one, meet my sister Uxie," she says cheerfully.

You blink a few times.

Sister...?

"Uh, nice to meet you," you say, awkwardly extending a hand.

The newcomer, who Mesprit called ‘Uxie’, seems to stare at you for a while, thinking.

Before smiling a little.
"Same here," she says, taking your extended hand in her paw and shaking it. You just seem to notice the softness of her paws...

"But, Mesprit," Uxie suddenly says.
"You said this human lives with you now?" she then asks.

Mesprit nods, blushing vaguely.
"Doesn't sound... wrong for a guardian?" Uxie asks.

You blink, confused.
"Guardian?" you ask, before recalling that Mesprit told you she protects this lake.

Mesprit smiles while looking at Uxie.
"Come on, sis, does THIS human look like a bad one?" she asks, before smiling even more.

"Come here you~" she then says, snatching you from her sister and hugging you lovingly. Blushing slightly, you hug back.

Looking at the scene, Uxie smiles.
"Alright, you've convinced me," she admits.

Mesprit rises her head.
"Hey, now that I think about it... why are you here in the first place?" she asks.

"Oh, y'know, I was kinda bored..." Uxie admits while rubbing her head. Mesprit giggles.

"Well, me and this little guy were just about to play..." she says as she looks at you...
1253322222112111222112.title: Oh sister

choices: You remain hidden until the time runs out...
You run out of breath and surface. Mesprit and Uxie find you...
12533222221121112221121.content:
"Let's resume our game!" Mesprit chimes cheerfully while eyeing you with glee. You smile, and nod your head.

"Game? What game?" Uxie wonders.
"Oh, right," Mesprit says, remembering that her sister just came by.

The pink headed guardian dons a bright smile.
"Just before you came here, we were playing-" Uxie interrupts.
"Wait. You referred to the human as ‘mouse’ when I came here, right?" she asks.

Mesprit nods, and closes one eye. Uxie had already figured the game before Mesprit even spoke.
"Alright. I'm in," the yellow headed pixie says with an amused smile.

Mesprit giggles, before looking at you again. She lowers her head in her paws, and gently pecks you.
"Good luck, cutie," she says, bending as she gently lets you down, before rising to her full height again.

From your shrunken size, both sisters looked like monolithic, living statues. And the fact that they're hovering in midair makes them look even bigger.

"Okay, starting now, we'll give you five minutes to get as far as possible from us," Mesprit says.
"Then, we'll come after you," Uxie adds.

"Okay?" you say.
"How much time do I have to escape you?" you ask.

Uxie and Mesprit start talking to each other.
"Three hours." both say in unison after a bit.

You nod your head.

Mesprit starts to turn around, while Uxie bends over, her head reaching your level.
"I know - we just met, but..." she smiles.
"Good luck, human," she says sympathetically. You smile back as the pixie rises back up to turn around.

And, without thinking twice, you sprint away from the two sisters.

--

You run through the thick forest around Lake Verity... although that with your diminished size, you surely didn't get too far. In fact, if you listen closely, you're sure you can still hear Uxie and Mesprit talking.

You start to run out of breath, and decide that this is a good moment to search for a hiding spot.

You start looking around for a good place to hide. A rather difficult task, since you're in a forest.

However, thanks to your small size, you could fit in plenty of places, like a hole in the ground or a small puddle...

"Oh, human~" a familiar voice echoes around. You recognize it as Mesprit.

But... that means that the five minutes you had to hide is up!

You frenetically start to look around for a hiding spot. And, finally, you spot a hole in the trunk of a tree.

Praying that it isn't the home of some Pachirisu, you run towards it and swiftly climb inside, before cowering. Right before Mesprit comes out.

"Human~! Where are you~?" Mesprit sings as she starts looking around for you. The guardian giggles to herself.
"Can't hide from me! I sense your emotions!" she says. In fact, she senses your emotions, coming straight from the tree you're hiding in.

But the psychic type decides to render things a bit more interesting and pretends to be unaware of your location.
"Come on out small one! I'll find you sooner or later!" she says as she moves over a random bush, turning her back to you.

From your hiding spot, you notice her actions, and decide that this is the perfect time to try to leave. Slowly, you climb out, and hop onto the ground, before starting to walk as you try to slip your way past Mesprit, who is busy searching in the bush.

But, as you start thinking that you'll make it the giantess starts giggling as she senses your emotions again... only not in the same place.

The guardian looks around, wearing a smirk on her face as she looks at you.
"Oh! Look who I found!" she exclaims with a giggle.

Immediately, the giantess starts floating around you at full speed. You let out a startled cry as you dodge her, before starting to run.

Mesprit starts chasing you.
"Won't get away~!" she exclaims.

However, against her predictions, you find a patch of tall grass and dive into it without even thinking.

Unable to see you any longer, Mesprit hovers above the patch, trying to spot her little one.

However, little does she know is that you're no longer around...

--

After finally managing to make Mesprit lose your tracks, you make your way towards the lake, hoping to take a breather. Luckily, you still hadn't ran into Uxie, and she wasn't around.

...

However, that was what you believed.

Unbeknownst to you, you were being watched. From the branches of a tree, Uxie smiles as she silently starts to descend.

Trying to regain your breath, you don't notice a figure floating behind you.

"Hi there," Uxie says.

Startled, you turn around, noticing the pixie towering above you.
"Uxie...!" you exclaim.

The pixie laughs.
"Looks like you underestimated me. Shouldn't have done that," Uxie giggles playfully as she picks you up, while your brain works the best it can to find a solution to escape the pixie.

And, as if fate itself wanted to lend a hand, you suddenly have an idea.

"Yeah? I think you shouldn't underestimate that guy with the Umbreon!" you say with a convincingly alerted expression as you point behind the giantess.

Alerted, Uxie turns around. And you throw yourself from Uxie's paws, landing on the ground, the grass mercifully breaking your fall. Without losing anymore time, you sprint away.

Upon realizing that no one was there, Uxie turns to face you... only to notice that you're no longer on her paw.

Instead, she notices you running away from her. Her facial expression shifts from a surprised one into a smirk.
"Oh, you little-" she starts chasing you while lowering herself to catch you, her paw extending as she flies closer to you.

You glance backwards, noticing the giantess about to grab you.

An idea springs up in your mind.

As Uxie gets even closer, you leap up. The giantess touches the ground with a surprised expression. You land onto the back of her paw, right in front of Uxie's face.

You smirk.
"See you later, Uxie!" you tease while leaping off her paw and running off, soon disappearing in the forest.

Uxie remains there for a couple of moments, mouth wide open.
"A human just outsmarted me..." she mumbles, before her mouth curls into a smirk.
"It'll be sweet when I catch you."

--

You have many other encounters with the two sisters. Somehow, though, you managed to make it to the lake again.

A lot of time passed since the game started, and by now you're seriously considering the fact that you might actually make it!

...

That before you hear both Mesprit and Uxie calling out for you... they're close!

Panicking, you look around, and glance at your last hiding spot: Lake Verity.

Doing a quick calculation, you estimate that you must hide for still a few minutes. Then, you would win.

Convinced, you walk over the lake and take a deep breath, before slipping into the water and diving.

Just as you disappear underwater, Uxie and Mesprit come out from the forest.
"Any luck?" Uxie asks.

Mesprit shakes her head.
"We have still a few minutes left," Uxie adds.
"Where could he be?"
12533222221121112221121.title: Pixies' playtime

choices: You manage to escape and the time runs out. You won!
125332222211211122211212.content:
You keep hiding underwater, watching the world through the crystalline water while desperately trying to hold your breath.

You almost won, you can do it...

Sadly, you soon start running out of breath. You try your best to remain underwater as long as you can, but you find it extremely difficult to do so...

And you soon come to the point where you can't resist any longer. A bunch of bubbles comes out of your mouth as you swim upwards and surface, letting a sigh of relief as your lungs fill up with fresh air. You lean forward, gripping the solid ground as you get out of the water, your body soaked to the bone.

Sadly, your break wasn't meant to last.

Looking around, trying to find you, Mesprit noticed something moving, sliding out of her lake and collapsing to the ground. She lost view of it when it disappeared into the grass, but she was sure of what it was - her little human.

Quietly, the guardian taps Uxie's shoulder, before gesturing towards where you are resting. Uxie smiles as she floats around, while Mesprit hovers in your direction.

Suddenly, a shadow eclipses your whole being. You glance upwards, noticing Mesprit staring down at you with her usual smirk.

"Hi human~" she sings as she bends, one of her paws darting towards you.

Without even thinking, you roll out of the way, the paw slamming into the ground where you were. It swiftly retreats back, and Mesprit is quick to bend again, both arms spread as she reaches out to grab you.

You spring back on your feet and jump back, her paws closing around nothing as she hits the ground. You find yourself staring straight at her golden eyes and back up slightly.

Sadly, you end up bumping into something soft.

You nervously glance upwards, noticing Uxie towering above you, a smile on her face. And you take note that you actually bumped into her tail, which starts to coil around your waist, intent to bring you upwards.

Startled, you bend, the tail now menacing to coil around your neck.
"Oh!" Mesprit exclaims as Uxie quickly stops, knowing that you might just end up dying like that.

"Are you out of your mind?" the yellow headed giantess exclaims as you leap away from the two giantesses. You simply smirk at her.

"How much time is left?" you ask. Uxie tilts her head.
"More or less, two minutes..." she responds. Mesprit smirks.
"Better start running~" she says cheerfully, extending her paw towards you.

You dodge it, and start running as Mesprit gets up, before she and Uxie start to chase you yet again.

"Watch out mouse~" you hear Mesprit shouting.
"Because we're coming!"
125332222211211122211212.title: The final round

12533222221122.content:
You didn't know why really, but its what would make you most happy and you were sure of it. Mesprit glided down from over the lake once more held a tiny paw stub to your cheek.

"whenever you're ready..." Mesprit softly whispered, its voice sounding more fragile then a baby's first breath...

It may have used magic on you to make your jaw more flexible or your throat mussels stronger and more animal like, but the whole process felt almost normal to you... You opened the cavern to your mouth and Mesprit stuck its head in, getting a deep whiff of your moist, hot insides. You began closing your lips around Mesprit's little frame and used your tongue to wrap around and slowly pull in more of Mesprit into you. Two tails hung limply and relaxed from your closed maw. A pair of stubby feet slipped into your mouth and wriggled a little.

choices: Ethan Wakes up in the Hall of Origen
125332222221222.content:
"There, that should patch you up." A kind voice said as he could be seen crouched down, patching up a Pichu, putting a small plaster on it's arm as it's parents, two Raichu, look on. Gently he patted the Pichu soft on it's head, who warmed up to his touch, smiling as it rubbed its cheek on his palm, before he stood back up. Once the male was finished the Pichu hopped off to it's parents, who hugged the young Pokemon with happiness, glad to see it's healed up. All three looked upwards to the male and gave him a sincere smile, which he gladly returned. Grabbing his rucksack over his shoulder he waved gently as he walked off into the forest as the two Mouse Pokemon waved back.

This was a young adult going only by the name of Ethan, with blonde hair and hazel eyes, he wore a simple jacket to keep away the cold, with an attire not worth noting, excluding the large backpack he carried. To many, he was a no one, just some wandering stranger with no house to call a home and no destination set in his mind. To those he was an mindless bum, but to Pokemon, he was seen as a saint. Friendly to all those he meets, he is remembered by the many he had met for his selfless and generous heart, always carrying food of all kinds and medical supplies as stocked up as he could, ready to share this with any Pokemon he finds hungry, help those who are lost and heal those who are hurt.

Little was known about him except his unselfish personality and his warm heart. As many Pokemon, whether he helped them or just happened to watch him, thought of him in the highest reverence, even if he would just bashfully admit he was nothing but a normal human being who simply loved helping others.

Right now, he was out of the forest and was walking up a rocky path, the wooded area ended right at the beginning of the mountainous area. Walking up the heightened path he peered to the side; no chain link fence supported the side, making it easy for someone to accidentally fall out, he kept to the wall side. However, this didn't stop him from peering outwards, seeing the beautiful landscape that only nature could make so beautiful. Unfortunately, walking forwards and staring to the side may not always be the best decision, as he didn't realize he had just walked into someone standing in the path.

The sudden stop made him fall backwards on his rear with an 'oof', looking upwards he noticed he had walked into the backside of a large human, much too big for his age, as he looked to be the same age as him, except wearing leather and metallic studs over his clothes; the kinds of people you wouldn't want to purposely make angry. And they were three of them!

"I am so so sorry." He apologised immediately, hoping he hadn't hurt the other man. Slowly, the male turned around, staring poison-tipped daggers at the meeker male. "Watch where you're going, punk!" The other, larger human spoke with a deep, intimidating voice. Ethan tried not to judge him. After all, what could would it do to judge someone without fully knowing who they were. That was what he believed.

"Look I'm sorry for what I had done, it's my fault for that. Please, I hope you could forgive me?" He tried to walk past them but a hand stopped him. This one belonging to a tall, lanky male with a purple mohawk and sharp, bright glasses. "Wat ya got in the backpack, kid?" Another spoke, this one belonging to short, pudgy, dirty male. All three were wearing the same kind of clothing; mainly a leather jacket and jeans. He started rummaging through his sack, but in one quick motion Ethan pulled away, hoping to not offend them in some way.

Please don't do that. All I have in here is food and supplies for Pokemon. I have some food if you are hungry." Quickly reaching in he pulled out chocolate bar, but was smacked away by the third human. His body tense up with fear.

"Hey, hey, hey, guy." The second guy spoke in a calm, almost friendly tone, as he slide to the side of the wandering male, putting an arm around his shoulder as he brung him closer with a sly grin. "We know what you thinking right now. I mean, you see three guys all dressed up in leather, skulking around an abandoned path and being all antisocial and the like. We know what you're thinking; 'oh my, three scary teens loitering around, they must be bad news.' Is that what you're thinking of us?"

Well...no but-"

"And I'm guessing you don't understand our predicament, do you? You see-" He stopped briefly as he pulled out a small object. Bringing it closer to Ethan's face he seemed to tap it slightly, only for the object to reveal itself as switchblade. The poor human's eyes widened when he saw this. "We. Need. Money. So, before it gets a little bit out of hand here..." He paused to drag the knife slowly across the other's cheeks. "We'll be taking yours. OK?" With the human stood firmly in place the mugger moved away to face the male. Snapping his fingers he called out. "Boys!"

The two others let their presence became known again as they both moved forward to search the wanderer's backpack, but in an instant he dared to move away from them both, only to be stopped by the second who firmly grabbed his arm.

"I've got nothing in here for you three. I'm sorry but I've got no money." He called out as he tried break away, but the mugger was not having any of it.

"Don't you fucking DARE take us for a bunch of fools!" He yelled. "How stupid do you think we are?"

"Let go! Please, these aren't for you!" He shouted, trying to plead to them to let himself go, but unfortunately the first, bigger male grabbed both his arms from behind, halting his movements.

"Please! HELP! HELP! HE-" He called out to someone, anyone. But in a single instant, he felt a sharp object pierce his chest, his breathing stopped as the words were caught in his throat, his muscles froze as he looked downwards, witnessing the mugger's knife had lodged itself in his torso. Slowly, the larger male let go, keeping a firm hold on the backpack as he pulled it off, letting the human drift backwards a few steps before dropping down in a lump, the only noise they seemed to hear was male dropping down onto the floor

"...why..?" He forced out before becoming silent. The first and third teen opened it up as they searched inside.

"Should not have done that." The second human said coldly, staring at the dying body laying on the forgotten path with a stoic expression. Turning back to his teammates the third mugger had said while rummaging through the backpack; "The damn kid was right, there's nothing in here but bloody bandages and Poke food. There isn't a single useful piece of garbage in here. Not even a fucking single PokeDollar. The hell was that kid doing."

"...please..." He managed to wheeze. The second mugger crouched down cupping his hand over his ear ah seems to listen intently. "...give those...to the…..Pokemon who….live… around here..." Giving off a laugh he stood up. He ushered the two to leave it alone, seeing as they have no use for it.

"Useless shit." The second one said as he spat on the ground. "We better go before someone see this." He announced before the three ran off, leaving the lone human to lie on the rock path, staring at the clouds as his vision blurred and he coughed up the red liquid, thinking about his prior life before this fatal moment.

He had little regrets. He lived his life to fullest, and he was content knowing it was a fulfilling life. What life could be better than helping out innocent Pokemon? To him he only wished he could have helped more.

"Rai?" A soft voice called to him, daring to look to the side he saw the visage of a Raichu staring at him with tear-filled eyes. A second Raichu stood by it, followed by a Pichu, one with a plaster on it's arm.

Hello again." He spoke softly as he feebly raised his hand over, and, ever so gently, stroked the small Pichu on it's head. "I'm sorry, it seems I am not able to see you again one more time." He said with a sad smile, watching the Tiny Mouse Pokemon cry into his hand. He hadn't realized a small gathering of other Pokemon, all different shapes and sizes stood over him, all of them witnessing the kind heart he had displayed to them in some form or another. Not a single one looked on without sadness plastered on their face, all knowing there was nothing they could do. Slowly, the males stroking stopped. His arm going limp on the floor as his final strength gave out, all Pokemon looking on in shock. Turning away the Pichu hugged it's mother Raichu for comfort who returned the hug back the same, letting the tears roll down.

Please." The mother Raichu spoke. "Please don't just die like this. You can't...just leave us like this. You are...were….just don't leave us."

"Arceus above." The male mouse Pokemon started as he looked up to the heavens. "If you can hear us, please, please, PLEASE help this human. Please, we're begging you."

"Arceus." A Pidgeotto called upwards.

"Arceus above." A Scyther said as well.

"ARCEUS, PLEASE HELP." They all said in unison, crying out to the Alpha Pokemon, there voices seemed to be nothing more than a helpless prayer, scattering to the wind, unknownst to the world as somewhere, in a void of nothingness, a being opened it's eyes as the voices of multiple Pokemon hit the creatures ears. Slowly, the creature, floating in the endless void, started to glow as it focused on the area of Pokemon calling out it's name

Who is calling my name?
125332222221222.title: Arceus Love
